newsitem.title: USA: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- Pre-holiday action light.
newsitem.headline: U.S. MUNICIPAL FOCUS -- Pre-holiday action light.

text.p: U.S. municipals opened Friday's abbreviated session unchanged, as the upcoming Memorial Day weekend thinned ranks on many trading desks.
"I'd say very unch'ed, aggressively unch'ed," said one trader asked to describe price action. He attributed the inactivity to a "long weekend, short day, half staff."

In the government market, the benchmark 30-year bond was up 6/32 at 95-20/32 to yield 6.98 percent. PSA The Bond Market Trade Association has recommended a 1400 EDT close for government bonds and related markets Friday, and a full close for Monday.
In debt futures the June municipal contract was up 7/32 at 116-17/32. The June T-bond was up 7/32 at 109-9/32. The MOB spread was 232 ticks.

Friday's actively quoted issues included New York State Energy Research and Development Authority 5-1/2 percent bonds of January 2021. The bonds had a net bid of 5.75 percent, a basis point weaker than Thursday's closing net bid of 5.74 percent.
